description: From Latin audacia (“boldness”), from audax (“bold”), from audeō (“I am bold, I dare”).

adjectives.description: audacious (comparative more audacious, superlative most audacious)

entries.meaning: Showing willingness to take bold risks; recklessly daring.
examples: That such a safe adaptation could come of The Hunger Games speaks more to the trilogy’s commercial ascent than the book’s actual content, which is audacious and savvy in its dark calculations.
